author: cory doctorow
text: michael hanson, a cpa from st. petersburg, florida, started playing  ultima online in november 1997. the gameplayer amassed more than 2.5 million gold pieces, along with assorted houses, castles, magical armor, and weapons, before cashing out. how? by selling his booty and characters, or avatars, for some $2,000 on ebay.hanson is part of a growing tide of gamepreneurs who are hawking their avatars online. it started in late february, when a player who calls himself turbohawk sold out for $521. soon after turbohawk's auction had closed, more than 25 other sets of avatars were on the bidding block, all going for hundreds of dollars. so far, hanson's $2k auction in march tops the charts."i'm going to miss the game," says the retiree.
